title: Birth Control

articles.content: The capacity to procreate is merely a potential which man is not obligated to actualize. The choice to have children or not is morally optional. Nature endows man with a variety of potentials—and it is his mind that must decide which capacities he chooses to exercise, according to his own hierarchy of rational goals and values.
articles.attribution:
“Of Living Death,”
The Voice of Reason, 55
